column1: Buchholz in der Nordheide is the largest town in the district of Harburg
column3: Germany. It is situated approximately 25 km southwest of Hamburg.

column1: Buchholz is home to the Brunsberg
column2: at 129m the highest mountain in the region. It is on the northern edge of the Lüneburg Heath (Lüneburger Heide).
Buchholz was struck by a small tornado which destroyed many trees and damaged numerous houses. In 2002
column3: the temperature in Buchholz rose above 38 degrees celsius
column4: marking an all-time high for its region.

column2: Buchholz tried to set a new world record by placing a crowd of 2000 people in the form of a large heart near the local swimming pool. The attempt ultimately failed because 39 people did not show up.

column5: Sprötze and Trelde belong to Buchholz.

column2: Wołów in Poland and Järvenpää in Finland.
